review_blob: Bottle -> Sam Adams Pint.  Dark Amber in color with a with a light tan colored head.  This ale has strong molasses and caramel malt scents with hints of apple.  Starts with a fruity caramel flavor and sweet malt, theres apple and pear and a bit of coco followed by a slightly citric hop finish.  Medium body that sticks around - maybe one or two a night of this one before it gets syrupy.

Unibroues Quelque Chose is a unique beer that could easily pass as a mixed drink or cocktail.  It has a strong cherry flavor, reminiscent of cough drops, with just a hint of vanilla.  This beer pours a cloudy maroon color and served over ice has little no no visible carbonation.  First few sips youll pickup a light spritz but ultimately its thin and almost watery in texture.

Right up front youll get the cherries and just a hint of tartness (not the strong tart you get in most krieks.)  Theres some vanilla too but I had trouble finding the cinnamon, clove and honey accents mentioned on the bottle.

Excellent desert beer - looking forward to trying it warmed as suggested by the brewer.
